name: Introduction to Sociolegal Studies (formerly WDW215H1)
description: The course covers several major issues that will help prepare students for advanced courses in the criminology major:  the meaning of law, the production of laws and legal institutions, law in action, comparative legal traditions, and the methodology of sociolegal studies.
department: Centre for Criminology and Sociolegal Studies
prerequisites: 4.0 FCEs and a minimum cgpa of 2.3 or enrolment in the Criminology & Sociolegal Studies program
